name: .TSCDF File Extension
summary: Learn about .TSCDF files and view a list of programs that open them.

description: A TSCDF file contains a device frame used by TechSmith Camtasia, a screen recording and video editing application. It stores an image or video that includes a device, such as a desktop, laptop, or mobile device, which frames a clip to make it appear that the recording is occurring on that device.

content: Camtasia is an application for Windows and macOS that captures screen activity, such as a video conference, how-to tutorial, software demonstration, or online gaming session. The application includes several default device frames, and you can also download more from the TechSmith library site.

You can access the device frames in Camtasia by selecting "Visual Effects" in the pane on the left side of the program interface, then drag and drop the "Device Frame" effect onto your video. Camtasia then frames the clip in that device.

You can change the device frame type by selecting the "Device Frame Type" dropdown menu in the right pane of the program interface. You can also select Download More... from the dropdown menu to download different device frames or select Remove Device Frames... to choose device frames to remove from the list.
NOTE: TSCDF stands for "TechSmith Camtasia Device Frame."

instructions: You can open TSCDF files with TechSmith Camtasia in Windows and macOS. To open and add TSCDF files in Camtasia, double-click the file and click OK in the prompt that notifies you that Camtasia successfully added the device frame as a visual effect.
